column4: I'm switching from ubuntu to xubuntu. What package should I remove to remove gnome?
just install xubuntu-desktop
I'm pressed for space. If I'm not using gnome, I want to uninstall it.
you can try removing ubuntu-desktop first (that will remove GNOME) then install xubuntu-desktop....
that should do it...but make sure first
sorry for the non-descript answer
make sure what?
let me look to see if GNOME came in a metapackage that you can uninstall
have you tried to remove GNOME yet?
nope.
go to a terminal and type 'sudo aptitude remove gnome'  see what happens
should pull all dependencies with it
OK, just as soon as my other apt proccess finishes.
btw, i remeber a program that found unused dependencies and libraries. do you happen to know the name?
Synaptic will automatically resolve dependencies (apt-get will as well with certain switches at the command line) Aptitude will resolve automatically
nothing happened.
sorry ;-(
Evidently, that metapackage isn't installed.
what if I apt-get it then aptitude remove it?
you can try that, but I don't think you'll have any luck that way either
